newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - February 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - February 25.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Ex-employee of American Institute in Taiwan says he has tape recording complaint of sexual harrassment by female visa applicant
Judicial authorities may charge five, including wife of former Pingtung county chief, for alleged involvement in pump station construction scandal
UNITED DAILY NEWS - U.S. Secretary of state Madeleine Albright calls on Taiwan and China to resume talks as soon as possible
Body of Chinese paramount leader Deng Xiaoping cremated, citizens pay last respects
LIBERTY TIMES - Lawmakers to propose making February 28 a public holiday in memory of victims killed in 1947 massacre
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Economics ministry decides to work out concrete set of guidelines for China investment
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Central bank may change stable-to-loose monetary policy in March
Economics ministry may bar Taiwan companies from investing in power plant projects in China
